intro: Randia stipularis, commonly known as the small-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial or shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. Randia stipularis is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
